042/**
043 * This class defines static utility methods adding to ImageJs functionality.
044 * @author WB
045 *
046 */
047public abstract class IjUtils {
048        
049        private IjUtils() {}
050        
051        /**
052         * Returns a (possibly empty) array of ImagePlus objects that are
053         * sorted by their titles if the 'sortByTitle' flag is set.
054         * 
055         * @param sortByTitle flag, result is sorted if true.
056         * @return an array of currently open images.
057         */
058        public static ImagePlus[] getOpenImages(boolean sortByTitle) {
059                return getOpenImages(sortByTitle, null);
060        }
061        
062
063        /**
064         * Returns an array of strings containing the short titles
065         * of the images supplied.
066         * 
067         * @param images array of images.
068         * @return array of names.
069         */
070        public static String[] getImageShortTitles(ImagePlus[] images) {
071                String[] imageNames = new String[images.length];
072                for (int i = 0; i < images.length; i++) {
073                        imageNames[i] = images[i].getShortTitle();
074                }
075                return imageNames;
076        }
077        
078        /**
079         * Opens a dialog to let the user select one of the currently open images.
080         * @param title string to show in the dialog
081         * @return An ImagePlus object, use the getProcessor method to obtain the associated ImageProcessor
082         */
083        public static ImagePlus selectOpenImage(String title) {
084                ImagePlus[] openImages = getOpenImages(true, null);
085                String[] imageNames = getImageShortTitles(openImages);
086                if (title == null) {
087                        title = "image:";
088                }
089                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog("Select image");
090                gd.addChoice(title, imageNames, imageNames[0]);
091                gd.showDialog(); 
092                if (gd.wasCanceled()) 
093                        return null;
094                else {
095                        return openImages[gd.getNextChoiceIndex()];
096                }
097        }
098        
099        
100        /**
101         * Returns a (possibly empty) array of {@link ImagePlus} objects that are
102         * sorted by their titles if the sortByTitle flag is set.
103         * The image "exclude" (typically the current image) is not included 
104         * in the returned array (pass null to exclude no image).
105         * 
106         * @param sortByTitle set {@code true} to return images sorted by title
107         * @param exclude reference to an image to be excluded (may be {@code null})
108         * @return a (possibly empty) array of {@link ImagePlus} objects
109         */
110        public static ImagePlus[] getOpenImages(boolean sortByTitle, ImagePlus exclude) {
111                List<ImagePlus> imgList = new LinkedList<ImagePlus>();
112                int[] wList = WindowManager.getIDList();
113        if (wList != null) {
114                for (int i : wList) {
115                    ImagePlus imp = WindowManager.getImage(i);
116                    if (imp != null && imp != exclude) {
117                        imgList.add(imp);
118                    }
119                }
120        }
121        ImagePlus[] impArr = imgList.toArray(new ImagePlus[0]);
122        if (sortByTitle) {
123                Comparator<ImagePlus> cmp = new Comparator<ImagePlus>() {
124                        public int compare(ImagePlus impA, ImagePlus impB) {
125                                return impA.getTitle().compareTo(impB.getTitle());
126                        }
127                };
128                Arrays.sort(impArr, cmp);
129        }
130                return impArr;
131        }
132        
133
134        /**
135         *  Queries the user for an arbitrary file to be opened.
136         *  
137         * @param title string to be shown in the interaction window.
138         * @return path of the selected resource.
139         */
140        public static String askForOpenPath(String title) {
141                OpenDialog od = new OpenDialog(title, "");
142                String dir = od.getDirectory();
143                String name = od.getFileName();
144                if (name == null)
145                        return null;
146                return encodeURL(dir + name);
147        }
148        
149        private static String encodeURL(String url) {
150                //url = url.replaceAll(" ","%20");      // this doesn't work with spaces
151                url = url.replace('\\','/');
152                return url;
153        }
154        
155        //----------------------------------------------------------------------
156        
157
158        /**
159         * Creates an ImageJ {@link ImagePlus} image for the matrix {@code M[r][c]} (2D array),
160         * where {@code r} is treated as the row (vertical) coordinate and
161         * {@code c} is treated as the column (horizontal) coordinate.
162         * Use {@code show()} to display the resulting image.
163         * 
164         * @param title image title
165         * @param M 2D array
166         * @return a new {@link ImagePlus} image
167         */
168        public static ImagePlus createImage(String title, float[][] M) {
169                FloatProcessor fp = new FloatProcessor(M[0].length, M.length);
170                for (int u = 0; u < M[0].length; u++) {
171                        for (int v = 0; v < M.length; v++) {
172                                fp.setf(u, v, M[v][u]);
173                        }
174                }
175                return new ImagePlus(title, fp);
176        }
177        
178
179        /**
180         * Creates an ImageJ {@link ImagePlus} image for the matrix {@code M[r][c]} (2D array),
181         * where {@code r} is treated as the row (vertical) coordinate and
182         * {@code c} is treated as the column (horizontal) coordinate.
183         * Use {@code show()} to display the resulting image.
184         * 
185         * @param title the image title
186         * @param M a 2D array holding the image data
187         * @return a new {@link ImagePlus} instance
188         */
189        public static ImagePlus createImage(String title, double[][] M) {
190                FloatProcessor fp = new FloatProcessor(M[0].length, M.length);
191                for (int u = 0; u < M[0].length; u++) {
192                        for (int v = 0; v < M.length; v++) {
193                                fp.setf(u, v, (float) M[v][u]);
194                        }
195                }
196                return new ImagePlus(title, fp);
197        }
198        
199        /**
200         * Sets the weighing factors for the color components used
201         * in RGB-to-grayscale conversion for the specified image {@code ip}.
202         * Note that this method can be applied to any {@link ImageProcessor}
203         * instance but has no effect unless {@code ip} is of type
204         * {@link ColorProcessor}. Applies standard (ITU-709) weights.
205         * 
206         * @param ip The affected image
207         */
208        public static void setRgbConversionWeights(ImageProcessor ip) {
209                setRgbConversionWeights(ip, 0.299, 0.587, 0.114);
210        }
211        
212        /**
213         * Sets the weighing factors for the color components used
214         * in RGB-to-grayscale conversion for the specified image {@code ip}.
215         * Note that this method can be applied to any {@link ImageProcessor}
216         * instance but has no effect unless {@code ip} is of type
217         * {@link ColorProcessor}.
218         * 
219         * @param ip The affected image
220         * @param wr Red weight
221         * @param wg Green weight
222         * @param wb Blue weight
223         */
224        public static void setRgbConversionWeights(ImageProcessor ip, double wr, double wg, double wb) {
225                if (ip instanceof ColorProcessor) {
226                        ((ColorProcessor) ip).setRGBWeights(wr, wg, wb);
227                }
228        }
229        
230        // -------------------------------------------------------------------
231        
232        /** 
233         * Returns a copy of the pixel data as a 2D double
234         * array with dimensions [x = 0..width-1][y = 0..height-1].
235         * @param fp the image
236         * @return the resulting array
237         */
238        public static double[][] toDoubleArray(FloatProcessor fp) {
239                final int width = fp.getWidth();
240                final int height = fp.getHeight();
241                float[] fPixels = (float[]) fp.getPixels();
242                double[][] dPixels = new double[width][height];
243                int i = 0;
244                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
245                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
246                                dPixels[u][v] = fPixels[i];
247                                i++;
248                        }
249                }
250                return dPixels;
251        }
252        
253        /**
254         * Creates a new {@link FloatProcessor} instance of size width x height
255         * from the given {@code double[][]} with dimensions 
256         * [x = 0..width-1][y = 0..height-1].
257         * 
258         * @param A a 2D {@code double} array
259         * @return a new {@link FloatProcessor} instance
260         */
261        public static FloatProcessor toFloatProcessor(double[][] A) {
262                final int width = A.length;
263                final int height = A[0].length;
264                float[] fPixels = new float[width * height];
265                int i = 0;
266                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
267                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
268                                fPixels[i] = (float) A[u][v];
269                                i++;
270                        }
271                }
272                return new FloatProcessor(width, height, fPixels);
273        }
274        
275        /**
276         * Creates a new {@link FloatProcessor} instance of size width x height
277         * from the given {@code float[][]} with dimensions 
278         * [x = 0..width-1][y = 0..height-1].
279         * 
280         * @param A a 2D {@code float} array
281         * @return a new {@link FloatProcessor} instance
282         */
283        public static FloatProcessor toFloatProcessor(float[][] A) {
284//              final int width = A.length;
285//              final int height = A[0].length;
286//              float[] fPixels = new float[width * height];
287//              int i = 0;
288//              for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
289//                      for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
290//                              fPixels[i] = A[u][v];
291//                              i++;
292//                      }
293//              }
294//              return new FloatProcessor(width, height, fPixels);
295                return new FloatProcessor(A);
296        }
297        
298        /**
299         * Converts a {@link FloatProcessor} to a {@code float[][]}.
300         * @param fp a {@link FloatProcessor}
301         * @return the resulting {@code float[][]}
302         */
303        public static float[][] toFloatArray(FloatProcessor fp) {
304//              final int w = fp.getWidth();
305//              final int h = fp.getHeight();
306//              float[][] A = new float[w][h];
307//              for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {
308//                      for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {
309//                              A[u][v] =  fp.getf(u, v);
310//                      }
311//              }
312//              return A;
313                return fp.getFloatArray();
314        }
315        
316        /**
317         * Converts the given RGB {@link ColorProcessor} to a scalar-valued
318         * {@link ByteProcessor}, using clearly specified RGB component weights.
319         * The processor's individual RGB component weights are used if they have
320         * been set (not null), otherwise ITU709 weights (see {@link RgbUtils#ITU709RgbWeights}) 
321         * are applied.
322         * This is to avoid problems with standard conversion methods in ImageJ, which depend 
323         * on a variety of factors (including current user settings).
324         * See also {@link ColorProcessor#getRGBWeights()}, {@link ColorProcessor#setRGBWeights(double[])},
325         * {@link ImageProcessor#convertToByteProcessor()}.
326         * 
327         * @param cp a {@link ColorProcessor}
328         * @return the resulting {@link ByteProcessor}
329         * @see #toByteProcessor(ColorProcessor, double[])
330         */
331        public static ByteProcessor toByteProcessor(ColorProcessor cp) {
332                if (cp.getRGBWeights() == null) {       // no weights are set
333                        return toByteProcessor(cp, null);
334                }
335                else {  // use the FloatProcessor's individual weights
336                        return cp.convertToByteProcessor();
337                }
338        }
339        
340        /**
341         * Converts the given RGB {@link ColorProcessor} to a scalar-valued
342         * {@link ByteProcessor}, applying the specified set of RGB component weights.
343         * The processor's individual weights (if set) are ignored.
344         * This is to avoid problems with standard conversion methods in ImageJ, which depend 
345         * on a variety of factors (including current user settings).
346         * See also {@link ColorProcessor#getRGBWeights()}, {@link ColorProcessor#setRGBWeights(double[])},
347         * {@link ImageProcessor#convertToByteProcessor()}.
348         * 
349         * @param cp a {@link ColorProcessor}
350         * @param rgbWeights a 3-vector of RGB component weights (must sum to 1)
351         * @return the resulting {@link ByteProcessor}
352         * @see RgbUtils#ITU601RgbWeights
353         * @see RgbUtils#ITU709RgbWeights
354         */
355        public static ByteProcessor toByteProcessor(ColorProcessor cp, double[] rgbWeights) {
356                if (rgbWeights == null) {
357                        rgbWeights = RgbUtils.getDefaultWeights();
358                }
359                if (rgbWeights.length != 3) {
360                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("rgbWeights must be of length 3");
361                }
362                double[] oldweights = cp.getRGBWeights();
363                cp.setRGBWeights(rgbWeights);
364                ByteProcessor bp = cp.convertToByteProcessor();
365                ((ColorProcessor) cp).setRGBWeights(oldweights);
366                return bp;
367        }
368        
369        /**
370         * Converts the given RGB {@link ColorProcessor} to a scalar-valued
371         * {@link FloatProcessor}, using clearly specified RGB component weights.
372         * The processor's individual RGB component weights are used if 
373         * set, otherweise default weights are used (see {@link RgbUtils#getDefaultWeights()}).
374         * This should avoid problems with standard conversion methods in ImageJ, which depend 
375         * on a variety of factors (including current user settings).
376         * See also {@link ColorProcessor#getRGBWeights()}, {@link ColorProcessor#setRGBWeights(double[])},
377         * {@link ImageProcessor#convertToFloatProcessor()}.
378         * 
379         * @param cp a {@link ColorProcessor}
380         * @return the resulting {@link FloatProcessor}
381         * @see #toFloatProcessor(ColorProcessor, double[])
382         */
383        public static FloatProcessor toFloatProcessor(ColorProcessor cp) {
384                if (cp.getRGBWeights() == null) {       // no weights are set
385                        return toFloatProcessor(cp, null);
386                }
387                else {  // use the FloatProcessor's individual weights
388                        return cp.convertToFloatProcessor();
389                }
390        }
391        
392        /**
393         * Converts the given RGB {@link ColorProcessor} to a scalar-valued
394         * {@link FloatProcessor}, applying the specified set of RGB component weights.
395         * If {@code null} is passed for the weights, default weights are used
396         * (see {@link RgbUtils#getDefaultWeights()}).
397         * The processor's individual weights (if set at all) are ignored.
398         * This should avoid problems with standard conversion methods in ImageJ, which depend 
399         * on a variety of factors (including current user settings).
400         * See also {@link ColorProcessor#getRGBWeights()}, {@link ColorProcessor#setRGBWeights(double[])},
401         * {@link ImageProcessor#convertToFloatProcessor()}.
402         * 
403         * @param cp a {@link ColorProcessor}
404         * @param rgbWeights a 3-vector of RGB component weights (must sum to 1)
405         * @return the resulting {@link FloatProcessor}
406         * @see RgbUtils#ITU601RgbWeights
407         * @see RgbUtils#ITU709RgbWeights
408         */
409        public static FloatProcessor toFloatProcessor(ColorProcessor cp, double[] rgbWeights) {
410                if (rgbWeights == null) {
411                        rgbWeights = RgbUtils.getDefaultWeights();
412                }
413                if (rgbWeights.length != 3) {
414                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("rgbWeights must be of length 3");
415                }
416                double[] oldweights = cp.getRGBWeights();
417                cp.setRGBWeights(rgbWeights);
418                FloatProcessor fp = cp.convertToFloatProcessor();
419                ((ColorProcessor) cp).setRGBWeights(oldweights);
420                return fp;
421        }
422        
423        /**
424         * Creates and returns a new {@code ByteProcessor} from
425         * the specified 2D {@code byte} array, assumed to be
426         * arranged in the form {@code A[x][y]}, i.e.,
427         * the first coordinate is horizontal, the second vertical.
428         * Thus {@code A.length} is the width and {@code A[0].length}
429         * the height of the resulting image.
430         * 
431         * @param A a 2D {@code byte} array
432         * @return a new {@code ByteProcessor} of size {@code A.length} x {@code A[0].length}
433         */
434        public static ByteProcessor toByteProcessor(byte[][] A) {
435                final int w = A.length;
436                final int h = A[0].length;
437                ByteProcessor bp = new ByteProcessor(w, h);
438                for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {
439                        for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {
440                                bp.putPixel(u, v, 0xFF & A[u][v]);
441                        }
442                }
443                return bp;
444        }
445        
446        public static byte[][] toByteArray(ByteProcessor bp) {
447                final int w = bp.getWidth();
448                final int h = bp.getHeight();
449                byte[][] A = new byte[w][h];
450                for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {
451                        for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {
452                                A[u][v] =  (byte) (0xFF & bp.get(u, v));
453                        }
454                }
455                return A;
456        }
457        
458        public static ByteProcessor toByteProcessor(int[][] A) {
459                final int w = A.length;
460                final int h = A[0].length;
461                ByteProcessor bp = new ByteProcessor(w, h);
462                for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {
463                        for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {
464                                int val = A[u][v];
465                                if (val < 0)
466                                        val = 0;
467                                else if (val > 255) 
468                                        val = 255;
469                                bp.putPixel(u, v, val);
470                        }
471                }
472                return bp;
473        }
474        
475        /**
476         * Opens the image from the specified {@link URI} and returns it
477         * as a {@link ImagePlus} instance.
478         * 
479         * @param uri the URI leading to the image (including extension)
480         * @return A new {@link ImagePlus} instance or {@code null} if not found
481         */
482        public static ImagePlus openImage(URI uri) {
483                Objects.requireNonNull(uri);
484                return new Opener().openImage(uri.toString());
485        }
486        
487        
488        // Methods for checking/comparing images (primarily used for testing)  ---------------------
489        
490        /**
491         * Checks if two images are of the same type.
492         * 
493         * @param ip1 the first image
494         * @param ip2 the second image
495         * @return true if both images have the same type
496         */
497        public static boolean sameType(ImageProcessor ip1, ImageProcessor ip2) {
498                return ip1.getClass().equals(ip2.getClass());
499        }
500        
501        /**
502         * Checks if two images have the same size.
503         * 
504         * @param ip1 the first image
505         * @param ip2 the second image
506         * @return true if both images have the same size
507         */
508        public static boolean sameSize(ImageProcessor ip1, ImageProcessor ip2) {
509                return ip1.getWidth() == ip2.getWidth() && ip1.getHeight() == ip2.getHeight();
510        }
511        
512        /**
513         * Checks if the given image is possibly a binary image. This requires that
514         * the image contains at most two different pixel values, one of which
515         * must be zero. All pixels are checked.
516         * This should work for all image types.
517         * More efficient implementations are certainly possible.
518         * 
519         * @param ip the image ({@link ImageProcessor}) to be checked
520         * @return true if the image is binary
521         */
522        public static boolean isBinary(ImageProcessor ip) {
523                final int width = ip.getWidth();
524                final int height = ip.getHeight();
525                int fgVal = 0;
526                boolean binary = true;
527                
528                outer:
529                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
530                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
531                                int val = 0x007FFFFF & ip.get(u, v); // = mantissa in case of float
532                                if (val != 0) {
533                                        if (fgVal == 0) {       // first non-zero value
534                                                fgVal = val;
535                                        }
536                                        else if (val != fgVal) {        // found another non-zero value
537                                                binary = false;
538                                                break outer;
539                                        }
540                                }
541                        }
542                }
543                
544                return binary;
545        }
546        
547        /**
548         * Checks if the given image is "flat", i.e., all pixels have
549         * the same value.
550         * This should work for all image types.
551         * 
552         * @param ip the image ({@link ImageProcessor}) to be checked
553         * @return true if the image is flat
554         */
555        public static boolean isFlat(ImageProcessor ip) {
556                final int width = ip.getWidth();
557                final int height = ip.getHeight();
558                boolean flat = true;
559                int fgVal = ip.get(0, 0);
560                
561                outer:
562                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
563                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
564                                int val = ip.get(u, v);
565                                if (val != fgVal) {
566                                        flat = false;
567                                        break outer;
568                                }
569                        }
570                }
571                
572                return flat;
573        }
574        
575        /**
576         * Collects all image coordinates with non-zero pixel values into an array
577         * of 2D points ({@link Pnt2d}).
578         * 
579         * @param ip an image (of any type)
580         * @return an array of 2D points
581         */
582        public static Pnt2d[] collectNonzeroPoints(ImageProcessor ip) {
583                List<Pnt2d> points = new ArrayList<>();
584                int M = ip.getWidth();
585                int N = ip.getHeight();
586                for (int v = 0; v < N; v++) {
587                        for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
588                                int val = 0x007FFFFF & ip.get(u, v); // = mantissa in case of float
589                                if (val != 0) {
590                                        points.add(PntInt.from(u, v));
591                                }
592                        }
593                }
594                return points.toArray(new Pnt2d[0]);
595        }
596        
597        // -----------------------------------------------------------------
598        
599        public static final double DefaultMatchTolerance = 1E-6;
600        
601        /**
602         * Checks if two images have the same type, size and content (using 
603         * {@link #DefaultMatchTolerance}).
604         * 
605         * @param ip1 the first image
606         * @param ip2 the second image
607         * @return true if both images have the same type and content
608         */
609        public static boolean match(ImageProcessor ip1, ImageProcessor ip2) {
610                return match(ip1, ip2, DefaultMatchTolerance);
611        }
612        
613        /**
614         * Checks if two images have the same type, size and content (using 
615         * the specified tolerance). 
616         * 
617         * @param ip1 the first image
618         * @param ip2 the second image
619         * @param tolerance the matching tolerance
620         * @return true if both images have the same type, size and content
621         */
622        public static boolean match(ImageProcessor ip1, ImageProcessor ip2, double tolerance) {
623                if (!sameType(ip1, ip2)) {
624                        return false;
625                }
626                if (!sameSize(ip1, ip2)) {
627                        return false;
628                }
629                
630                if (ip1 instanceof ByteProcessor) {
631                        byte[] p1 = (byte[]) ip1.getPixels();
632                        byte[] p2 = (byte[]) ip2.getPixels();
633                        return Arrays.equals(p1, p2);
634                }
635                else if (ip1 instanceof ShortProcessor) {
636                        short[] p1 = (short[]) ip1.getPixels();
637                        short[] p2 = (short[]) ip2.getPixels();
638                        return Arrays.equals(p1, p2);
639                }
640                else if (ip1 instanceof ColorProcessor) {
641                        int[] p1 = (int[]) ip1.getPixels();
642                        int[] p2 = (int[]) ip2.getPixels();
643                        return Arrays.equals(p1, p2);
644                }
645                
646                else if (ip1 instanceof FloatProcessor) {
647                        float[] p1 = (float[]) ip1.getPixels();
648                        float[] p2 = (float[]) ip2.getPixels();
649                        boolean same = true;
650                        final float toleranceF = (float) tolerance;
651                        for (int i = 0; i < p1.length; i++) {
652                                if (Math.abs(p1[i] - p2[i]) > toleranceF) {
653                                        same = false;
654                                        break;
655                                }
656                        }
657                        return same;
658                }
659
660                throw new IllegalArgumentException("unknown processor type " + ip1.getClass().getSimpleName());
661        }
662        
663        // BitMap from/to ByteProcessor conversion
664        /**
665         * Converts the specified {@link ByteProcessor} to a {@link BitMap}
666         * of the same size,
667         * with all zero values set to 0 and non-zero values set to 1.
668         * @param bp a {@link ByteProcessor}
669         * @return the corresponding {@link BitMap}
670         * @see #convertToByteProcessor(BitMap)
671         */
672        public static BitMap convertToBitMap(ByteProcessor bp) {
673                return new BitMap(bp.getWidth(), bp.getHeight(), (byte[]) bp.getPixels());
674        }
675
676        /**
677         * <p>
678         * Converts the specified {@link BitMap} to a {@link ByteProcessor}
679         * of the same size,
680         * with all zero values set to 0 and non-zero values set to 1.
681         * The resulting image should be multiplied by 255 to achieve full
682         * contrast, e.g.:
683         * </p>
684         * <pre>
685         * ByteProcessor bp1 = ... // some ByteProcessor
686         * BitMap bm = IjUtils.convertToBitMap(bp);
687         * ByteProcessor bp2 = IjUtils.convertToByteProcessor(bm);
688         * bp2.multiply(255);
689         * ... </pre>
690         * 
691         * @param bitmap a {@link BitMap}
692         * @return the corresponding {@link ByteProcessor}
693         * @see #convertToBitMap(ByteProcessor)
694         */
695        public static ByteProcessor convertToByteProcessor(BitMap bitmap) {
696                byte[] pixels = bitmap.getBitVector().toByteArray();
697                return new ByteProcessor(bitmap.getWidth(), bitmap.getHeight(), pixels);
698        }
699        
700        public static void drawPoints(ImageProcessor ip, Pnt2d[] points, int value) {
701                for (int i = 0; i < points.length; i++) {
702                        Pnt2d p = points[i];
703                        if (p != null) {
704                                int u = p.getXint();
705                                int v = p.getYint();
706                                ip.putPixel(u, v, value);
707                        }
708                }
709        }
710        
711        // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
712        
713        /**
714         * Runs the given {@link PlugInFilter} instance with empty argument string.
715         * @param pluginfilter an instance of {@link PlugInFilter} 
716         * @return true if no exception was thrown
717         */
718        public static boolean run(PlugInFilter pluginfilter) {
719                return run(pluginfilter, "");
720        }
721        
722        /**
723         * Runs the given {@link PlugInFilter} instance.
724         * @param pluginfilter an instance of {@link PlugInFilter} 
725         * @param arg argument passed to {@link PlugInFilter#setup(String, ImagePlus)}
726         * @return true if no exception was thrown
727         */
728        public static boolean run(PlugInFilter pluginfilter, String arg) {
729                try {
730                        new PlugInFilterRunner(pluginfilter, pluginfilter.getClass().getSimpleName(), arg);
731                } catch (Exception e) {
732                        return false;
733                }
734                return true;
735        }
736        
737        /**
738         * Runs the given {@link PlugIn} instance with empty argument string.
739         * @param plugin an instance of {@link PlugIn}
740         * @return true if no exception was thrown
741         */
742        public static boolean run(PlugIn plugin) {
743                return run(plugin, "");
744        }
745        
746        /**
747         * Runs the given {@link PlugIn} instance.
748         * @param plugin an instance of {@link PlugIn}
749         * @param arg argument passed to {@link PlugIn#run(String)}
750         * @return true if no exception was thrown
751         */
752        public static boolean run(PlugIn plugin, String arg) {
753                try {
754                        plugin.run(arg);
755                } catch (Exception e) {
756                        return false;
757                }
758                return true;
759        }
760        
761        // ------------------------------------------------------------------
762        
763        /**
764         * Run a {@link PlugInFilter} from the associated class with empty argument string.
765         * If the plugin's constructor is available, use method {@link #run(PlugInFilter)} instead.
766         * @param clazz class of the pluginfilter
767         * @return true if no exception was thrown
768         */
769        public static boolean runPlugInFilter(Class<? extends PlugInFilter> clazz) {
770                return runPlugInFilter(clazz, "");
771        }
772        
773        /**
774         * Run a {@link PlugInFilter} from the associated class.
775         * If the plugin's constructor is available, use method {@link #run(PlugInFilter, String)} instead.
776         * @param clazz class of the plugin
777         * @param arg argument string
778         * @return true if no exception was thrown
779         */
780        public static boolean runPlugInFilter(Class<? extends PlugInFilter> clazz, String arg) {
781                PlugInFilter thePlugIn = null;
782                try {
783                        thePlugIn = clazz.getDeclaredConstructor().newInstance();
784                } catch (InstantiationException | IllegalAccessException | IllegalArgumentException
785                                | InvocationTargetException | NoSuchMethodException | SecurityException e) {
786                        throw new RuntimeException(e.getMessage());     // should never happen
787                }
788                return run(thePlugIn, arg);
789        }
790        
791        /**
792         * Run a {@link PlugIn} from the associated class with empty argument string.
793         * If the plugin's constructor is available, use method {@link #run(PlugIn)} instead.
794         * @param clazz class of the plugin
795         * @return true if no exception was thrown
796         */
797        public static boolean runPlugIn(Class<? extends PlugIn> clazz) {
798                return runPlugIn(clazz, "");
799        }
800        
801        /**
802         * Run a {@link PlugIn} from the associated class.
803         * If the plugin's constructor is available, use method {@link #run(PlugIn, String)} instead.
804         * @param clazz class of the plugin
805         * @param arg argument string
806         * @return true if no exception was thrown
807         */
808        public static boolean runPlugIn(Class<? extends PlugIn> clazz, String arg) {
809                PlugIn thePlugIn = null;
810                try {
811                        thePlugIn = clazz.getDeclaredConstructor().newInstance();
812                } catch (InstantiationException | IllegalAccessException | IllegalArgumentException
813                                | InvocationTargetException | NoSuchMethodException | SecurityException e) {
814                        throw new RuntimeException(e.getMessage());     // should never happen
815                }
816                return run(thePlugIn, arg);
817        }
818
819        
820        //  static methods for filtering images using ImageJ's {@link Convolver} class. 
821
822        /**
823         * Applies a one-dimensional convolution kernel to the given image,
824         * which is modified. The 1D kernel is applied in horizontal direction only.#
825         * The supplied filter kernel is not normalized.
826         * 
827         * @param ip the image to be filtered (modified)
828         * @param h the filter kernel
829         * @see Convolver
830         */
831        public static void convolveX (ImageProcessor ip, float[] h) { // TODO: unit test missing
832                Convolver conv = new Convolver();
833                conv.setNormalize(false);
834                conv.convolve(ip, h, h.length, 1);
835        }
836
837        /**
838         * Applies a one-dimensional convolution kernel to the given image,
839         * which is modified. The 1D kernel is applied in vertical direction only.
840         * The supplied filter kernel must be odd-sized. It is not normalized.
841         * 
842         * @param ip the image to be filtered (modified)
843         * @param h the filter kernel
844         * @see Convolver
845         */
846        public static void convolveY (ImageProcessor ip, float[] h) {
847                Convolver conv = new Convolver();
848                conv.setNormalize(false);
849                conv.convolve(ip, h, 1, h.length);
850        }
851
852        /**
853         * Applies a one-dimensional convolution kernel to the given image,
854         * which is modified.
855         * The same 1D kernel is applied twice, once in horizontal and once in
856         * vertical direction.
857         * The supplied filter kernel must be odd-sized. It is not normalized.
858         * 
859         * @param ip the image to be filtered (modified)
860         * @param h the filter kernel
861         * @see Convolver
862         */
863        public static void convolveXY (ImageProcessor ip, float[] h) {
864                Convolver conv = new Convolver();
865                conv.setNormalize(false);
866                conv.convolve(ip, h, h.length, 1);
867                conv.convolve(ip, h, 1, h.length);
868        }
869        
870        /**
871         * Applies a two-dimensional convolution kernel to the given image,
872         * which is modified. The supplied kernel {@code float[x][y]} must be 
873         * rectangular and odd-sized. It is not normalized.
874         * 
875         * @param ip the image to be filtered (modified)
876         * @param H the filter kernel
877         */
878        public static void convolve(ImageProcessor ip, float[][] H) {
879                float[] h = Matrix.flatten(H);  // TODO: right order? transpose?
880                Convolver conv = new Convolver();
881                conv.setNormalize(false);
882                conv.convolve(ip, h, H[0].length, H.length);
883        }
884
885}
